3 ExampleRosClass::ExampleRosClass(ros::NodeHandle* nodehandle):nh(*nodehandle)
4 {
5  ROS_INFO("in class constructor of ExampleRosClass");
6  loadParameters();
7  initializeSubscribers();
8  initializePublishers();
9  initializeServices();
10  initializeDynamicReconfigurations();
11  initializeTransformBroadcaster();
12 }
13 void ExampleRosClass::loadParameters()
14 {
15  std::string log;
16  if(nh.hasParam("example_node/param1"))
17  {
18  nh.getParam("example_node/param1",param1);
19  log = "param1 - loaded, ";
20  }
21  else
22  {
23  log = "param1 - not loaded, ";
24  }
25  if(nh.hasParam("example_node/param2"))
26  {
27  nh.getParam("example_node/param2",param2);
28  log += "param2 - loaded";
29  }
30  else
31  {
32  log += "param2 - not loaded";
33  }
34  ROS_INFO("This is fun %s",log.c_str());
35 }
36 void ExampleRosClass::initializeSubscribers()
37 {
38  ROS_INFO("Initializing Subscribers");
39  minimal_subscriber = nh.subscribe("example_class_input_topic", 1,
40  &ExampleRosClass::subscriberCallback,
41  this);
42 }
43 void ExampleRosClass::initializeServices()
44 {
45  ROS_INFO("Initializing Services");
46  minimal_service = nh.advertiseService("example_minimal_service",
47  &ExampleRosClass::serviceCallback,
48  this);
49 }
50 void ExampleRosClass::initializePublishers()
51 {
52  ROS_INFO("Initializing Publishers");
53  minimal_publisher = nh.advertise<std_msgs::Float32>("example_class_output_topic",
54  100,
55  true);
56 }
57 void ExampleRosClass::subscriberCallback(const std_msgs::Float32& message_holder)
58 {
59  val_from_subscriber = message_holder.data;
60  ROS_INFO("myCallback activated: received value %f", val_from_subscriber);
61 }
62 bool ExampleRosClass::serviceCallback(std_srvs::TriggerRequest& request, std_srvs::TriggerResponse& response)
63 {
64  ROS_INFO("service callback activated");
65  response.success = true;
66  response.message = "here is a response string";
67  return true;
68 }
69 void ExampleRosClass::initializeDynamicReconfigurations()
70 {
71  server.setCallback(boost::bind(&ExampleRosClass::reconfigCallback, this, _1, _2));
72 }
73 void ExampleRosClass::initializeTransformBroadcaster()
74 {
75  ROS_INFO("Initializing Transform Broadcaster");
76  tf::Transform transform;
77  x_coord = 0.0;
78  y_coord = 0.0;
79  transform.setOrigin(tf::Vector3(x_coord, y_coord, 0.0));
80  tf::Quaternion q;
81  q.setRPY(0, 0, 0);
82  transform.setRotation(q);
83  br.sendTransform(tf::StampedTransform(transform, ros::Time::now(), "world", "base_link"));
84 }
85 void ExampleRosClass::reconfigCallback(template_pkg::ExampleNodeConfig &config, uint32_t level)
86 {
87  ROS_INFO("Reconfigure Request: %d %f %s %s %d",
88  config.int_param, config.double_param,
89  config.str_param.c_str(),
90  config.bool_param?"True":"False",
91  config.size);
92 }
93 void ExampleRosClass::publishMessage(float count)
94 {
95  std_msgs::Float32 msg;
96  msg.data = count;
97  ROS_INFO("Publishing Message: %f", msg.data);
98  /*
99  * The publish() function is how you send messages. The parameter
100  * is the message object. The type of this object must agree with the type
101  * given as a template parameter to the advertise call
102  */
103  minimal_publisher.publish(msg);
104 }
105 void ExampleRosClass::broadcastTransform(const double& dx, const double& dy)
106 {
107  // increment the transform coordinates
108  x_coord = x_coord + dx;
109  y_coord = y_coord + dy;
110  ROS_INFO("Broadcasting Transform: x=%f y=%f", x_coord, y_coord);
111  tf::Transform transform;
112  transform.setOrigin(tf::Vector3(x_coord, y_coord, 0.0));
113  tf::Quaternion q;
114  q.setRPY(0, 0, 0);
115  transform.setRotation(q);
116  br.sendTransform(tf::StampedTransform(transform, ros::Time::now(), "world", "base_link"));
117 }
118 void ExampleRosClass::listenTransform()
119 {
120  tf::StampedTransform transform;
121  try
122  {
123  listener.lookupTransform("/world", "/base_link", ros::Time(0), transform);
124  }
125  catch (tf::TransformException ex)
126  {
127  ROS_ERROR("%s", ex.what());
128  ros::Duration(1.0).sleep();
129  return;
130  }
131  // publish the y coordinate to the example_class_output_topic
132  publishMessage(transform.getOrigin().y());
133 }
138 int main(int argc, char** argv)
139 {
140  ros::init(argc, argv, "exampleRosClass");
141  ros::NodeHandle n;
142  ROS_INFO("main: instantiating an object of type ExampleRosClass");
143  ExampleRosClass exampleRosClass(&n);
144  ROS_INFO("main: going into spin; let the callbacks do all the work");
145  ros::Rate r(1.0); // 1 hz
146  const double dx = 0.005; const double dy = 0.01;
147  while (ros::ok())
148  {
149  // broadcast a transform
150  exampleRosClass.broadcastTransform(dx, dy);
151  // spin for callbacks
152  ros::spinOnce();
153  r.sleep();
154  // listen to a transform
155  exampleRosClass.listenTransform();
156  }
157  return 0;
158 }
